seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Arts Programs Connect Through artlook®
posts.content:
With the dream of increasing access to quality arts programs in local schools, Walton Arts Center and CACHE partnered to bring artlook® to Northwest Arkansas.

  • Joining forces: artlook® is a map-based online tool where schools across Washington, Benton, and Madison counties can share information about arts education resources and specific needs.
  • Join the platform: Each school that completed its profile by the end of 2022 was eligible to receive a $500 grant to benefit its arts programs. 

Take a look around artlook® HERE.

posts.title: Up Your Next Event’s Beverage Game With The Beerdrop
posts.content:
The Beerdrop Co is a mobile tap experience bringing any drink to any event anywhere in their custom teardrop camper designed to hold five kegs in its fully refrigerated interior. 

  • Raise a glass: Beer, wine, seltzer, cold brew coffee, kombucha; you name it. The Beerdrop can serve events ranging from 30 people to 300.  
  • Get things rolling: The mobile tap is already booking dates for 2023, so fill out an online inquiry today to book the Beerdrop and make your next event a one-of-a-kind experience! 

Keep up with The Beerdrop on Instagram HERE.

posts.title: J.B. Hunt Announces Quarterly Earnings And Bonuses
posts.content:
This week J.B. Hunt released its fourth-quarter earnings statement and announced plans to give nearly $9m in appreciation bonuses to full-time employees.

  • By the numbers: The company reported earnings of over $201m compared with the $242m earned in the fourth quarter of 2021. Revenue saw a jump this quarter, bringing in $3.64b over last year's $3.49b.
  • Saying thanks: J.B. Hunt will award over $8.8m in appreciation bonuses to full-time drivers, maintenance, and office employees.

Read more on the story on Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Heirloom At The 1907 Is An Unforgettable Dining Experience
posts.content:
We had the chance to check out Heirloom at the 1907, the hidden restaurant located at the Onyx Headquarters in Downtown Rogers, and we just can't stop talking about it.

  • Atmosphere: From reservation to exit, Danielle Ribuado and her team make hospitality an art form, weaving excellence into the tiniest details - even down to the playlist in the background - and creating a highly personalized experience, so you can enjoy an unhurried dinner that you won't forget.
  • Intentionality: Rotating a prix fixe menu every 4-6 weeks, Chef Jason Paul guides your tastebuds through a multi-course culinary journey. The restaurant seats only 20 people and serves by reservation only 3-4 nights a week to ensure every patron receives the highest quality experience.

Reservations drop on the 15th of each month and book up quickly. If you miss those, you can join the waitlist HERE.

posts.title: American Heart Association Backs Bentonville-Based Sober Sidekick
posts.content:
Sidekick Mobile Technologies made a giant leap forward in their $2m seed funding round after receiving $250,000 from global healthcare leader American Heart Association.

  • At your side: The startup's mobile app, Sober Sidekick, provides sobriety tracking tools, daily motivations, 24/7 access to virtual AA meetings, and chat rooms for peer-to-peer support.
  • Changing the game: The founders' strong commitment to only profit from partners that benefit from addicts' continued sobriety instead of continued relapse is disrupting the behavioral health system by forcing it to work towards long-term health outcomes.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Your Guide To Music Festivals In Arkansas
posts.content:
It's not too late to add "attend a Northwest Arkansas music festival" to your resolutions for 2023! Check out Arkansas.com's Guide To Music Festivals In Arkansas, including exciting festivals in NWA like FORMAT, Momentous, Hillberry, and the Ozark Folk Festival.

  • Don't wait: If you're not one for procrastinating, hop over to Eureka Springs this weekend for OzMaMu, a four-day folk music event at the 1905 Basin Park Hotel from Jan 19-22.
  • Patience: May feels forever away, but it'll be here before we know it. So get your tickets for FreshGrass | Bentonville before they're gone so you can enjoy the best in bluegrass and roots music coming to the Momentary May 19-20.

Explore other festivals coming our way HERE.

posts.title: Housing Affordability Exceeds Reach Of Average Wage Earner
posts.content:
Attom Data Solutions' recent 2022 U.S. Home Affordability Report reveals that housing affordability has worsened across Northwest Arkansas, making it hard for first-time home buyers to navigate the housing market.

  • Big budget lines: The national average of a person's paycheck spent on mortgage and housing expenses is 32.3%. Comparatively, the study found Benton County's average was 29% and Washington County's 36%.
  • Outpaced: While average wages have increased since last year, they've not matched the pace of rising home prices. In Benton County, wages are up 3%, but the median home price rose 10% last year. In Washington County, wages rose by 9% and home prices by 14%.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Say I Do To The 5th Annual Wedding Fair At The Apollo This Weekend
posts.content:
The Apollo on Emma invites you to meet Northwest Arkansas's top wedding and event vendors during the 5th Annual Wedding Fair this Sunday, Jan 22, from 12-4p.

  • Save the date: Sample caterers, explore stunning reception set up's, sip some bubbly, taste test cake, and register to win up to $1500 towards a venue package. Honestly, even if you're not engaged, this sounds like a killer date idea.
  • RSVP: The event is free to attend, but you must register on Eventbrite. The first 50 guests will receive a swag bag filled with local merch.

Find more information and register HERE.

posts.title: New Brewery Announces Plans For Location In East Fayetteville
posts.content:
Fayetteville Beer Works has plans to open by this summer near the intersection of Mission and Crossover on the east side of town.

  • Homebrew: The brewery is the idea of local entrepreneur Brian O'Connell who helped found the Colorado-based Renegade Brewing Co in Denver.
  • New chill spot: O'Connell aims for Fayetteville Beer Works to be a family-friendly hang-out with a rotating menu of small-batch beers and hopes to find a partnering food truck to add to the experience.

Read more on the story in the Fayetteville Flyer HERE.

posts.title: Razorbacks Turned Up The Speed During The Arkansas Invitational
posts.content:
Razorback Track & Field put their speed on display last Friday during the Arkansas Invitational, with both men's and women's teams kicking off the indoor season with record-setting times.

  • Guys: The men's team completed a 1-2-3 finish in the 300m, with James Benson II and Lance Lang producing the third and fourth fastest collegiate times. Chris Baily won the 600m setting an Arkansas record at 1:15.18, which is No. 6 on the collegiate all-time list and No. 10 in the world.
  • Gals: For the women's team, Razorback Britton Wilson set a new collegiate record in the 600m, posting a time of 1:25.16, which ranks No. 7 in the U.S. and No. 10 worldwide. The team also locked in a 1-2-3 finish in the mile race and swept the top four spots in the 200m.

Purchase tickets for the next Track & Field event HERE.

posts.title: So Chill Eat to Open Second and Third Locations in NWA
posts.content:
With its original location in Siloam Springs, So Chill Eat - asian kitchen cuisine with a mix of Thai, Vietnamese, and Chinese will open in a few locations this year

  • Next in line: Landing a spot in Rogers at Pleasant Grove, they will be opening their doors on January 30th. The menu consists of a little bit of everything: curry's, wok mixes, ramen, pho, and sushi, with vegan and gluten free options.
  • Rolled up: According to the website, the third location will be Springdale sometime this year, but no locations or dates have been announced.

Read more about So Chill Eat's expansion plans HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville History Museum Grand Opening is This Weekend
posts.content:
Celebrating its 150th year, the City of Bentonville has taken a step in preserving and remembering this history by opening a museum dedicated to the History of Bentonville.

  • Blast to the past: This Saturday from 1-4p the Bentonville History Museum will open its doors welcoming the public to go back in time as it celebrates the young and the old.
  • Tour of history: Located in Bentonville’s former Train Depot, the Museum aims to preserve the past 150 years for the future with collections, education, and displays for locals and visitors alike.

Learn more about the grand opening HERE.

posts.title: Ozark Mountain Music Festival Returns This Week for a 9th Year
posts.content:
Ozark Mountain Music Festival, or OzMoMu, kicks off this week in Eureka Springs - bringing with it American Roots and Modern Folk to the Ozarks.

  • Encore: Performances begin Thursday evening and continue for four days on multiple stages at the 1905 Basin Park Hotel with late night and morning music being held at nearby venues.
  • Stage of its own: What makes this festival unique is that its the only outdoor festival held indoors. One of the venues is an old speakeasy cave - 'Down the Rabbett Hole'. There are themed nights, hotel door decorating contest, and yoga with mimosas.

Learn more about the OzMoMu Festival HERE.

posts.title: Arvest Bank Sees Success in New Program for Small Businesses
posts.content:
The Arvest Opportunity Fund was launched across Arvest’s four-state footprint in August. As of Jan. 6, the Arvest Opportunity Fund has delivered more than $1.2 million in small business loans.

  • Sub loan requirements: The Opportunity Fund is a wholly owned non-bank subsidiary providing loans and lines of credit. The loan requires recipients also receive financial education coaching for 12 months after funding.
  • Leg-up: The financial education program, delivered by professional educators and community partners, is designed to improve the financial standing of recipients to the point where they can eventually meet traditional bank lending standards.

You can read more about the Opportunity Fund HERE.

posts.title: U of A Receives $750,000 Grant to Help Connect Regional Farmers to Customers
posts.content:
The National Science Foundation has given a $750,000 grant to the University of Arkansas’ Institute for Integrative and Innovative Research (I³R) to fund a project designed to connect regional farmers

  • Healthy intentions: the project is designed to connect regional farmers with institutional buyers and ultimately expand access to healthy and nutritious food. The project brings Division of Agriculture researchers together with colleagues from the U of A and University of Florida, including two startups, Cureate and Junction AI Inc.
  • End game: The project team ultimately will create a scalable technology platform that provides market insights to small farmers via the convergence of multiple scientific research fields and modern technological innovations such as robotics, artificial intelligence and machine learning.

You can read more about the store by Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Events are few and far between this time of year, but we still managed to find some fun ones going on in NWA this weekend...

  • Recommitment Celebration: NWA MLK Council is hosting their 27th Annual Recommitment Celebration this Saturday from 5-9p.
  • Comic convention: NWA Comic Con is this weekend at the Rogers Convention Center. The event is all day both Saturday and Sunday.
  • Eyes to the sky: Book your bald eagle watch tour this Saturday morning at Hobbs State Park.
  • Pass the popcorn: Fay Film Festival has a mini film series this evening that includes Indie Films from Central and South America.
  • Modern classic: The 5 Browns will be performing Saturday evening at the Walton Arts Center.
  • Still, Life: 21c Bentonville has an opening ceremony for its new art exhibit Saturday evening from 4-6p. You can RSVP here.
  • Beat goes on: If live music is your jam, you can see a rundown of who is playing where this weekend with Talking Tunes.

Have a great weekend! We'll be back Monday.

posts.title: Registration Opens for the Square to Square Spring Bike Ride
posts.content:
What might be too early for your event calendar, but not ours is the Square 2 Square bike ride.

  • Fall in line: The Spring ride is scheduled for May 6 and the traffic will be moving north as riders ride from the Fayetteville Square to Bentonville Square.
  • The details: Online registration has officially opened and riders can sign up from now until May 3 for the 24-ish mile trek. With the event organizers offering shuttles, multiple rest stops, and on trail support, you've got plenty of time to get those legs spinning before May 6.

Read more about the event HERE.

posts.title: Rogers Planning Commission Approves Indoor, Upscale Go-kart Track
posts.content:
A few meetings ago, the City of Rogers Planning Commission approved a conditional use for K1 Speed - an 'indoor all electric premier go karting facility'.

  • Located at 2111 W. Walnut Street behind Frisco Station Mall would be an upscale entertainment concept that brings in the casual racer and racing enthusiast with speeds
  • Each location is designed as a large entertainment venue with professionally designed track, racing memorabilia, and trackside seating and viewing areas for spectators.

No timeline has been announced yet, but you can read more about the franchise HERE.

posts.title: City of Fayetteville Named Trendsetter City and Volunteer Community of the Year
posts.content:
Fayetteville received two awards at an awards luncheon held yesterday during the Arkansas Municipal League’s 2023 Winter Conference in Little Rock. 

  • Right vibe: The City was named a 2022 Trendsetter City for its Report a Concern online feature, which won the Technology and Security category that recognizes “advances in using technology to improve city communications or services".
  • Helping hand: Separately, Fayetteville was recognized as a 2022 Volunteer Community of the Year for its dedication to environmental protection and conservation, both in the City’s sustainability efforts as an organization and its residents’ year-round engagement. 

Read the full press release from the City HERE.

posts.title: Mercy Adding 32 New Physicians And Health Care Providers
posts.content:
Mercy NWA just upped its healthcare game by adding some heavy hitters to its team, expanding its capabilities and giving patients in NWA even more access to top-notch care.

  • 32 hires: These new providers come from a variety of specialties, including primary care, pediatrics, and OB/GYN. This addition inches the hospital closer to its 100 new headcount goal which is nearly double from two years ago.
  • Why it matters: With these new additions, patients can expect shorter wait times, more specialized care options, and the luxury of knowing they're being treated by experienced professionals.

Learn more about Mercy's vision for NWA and expected upgrades HERE.

posts.title: The Best of XNA in 2022
posts.content:
With 2022 coming to a close, Fare Flight NWA put together their top 5 "best successes" at XNA.

  • New routes: Coming in at the top were the new direct flight routes, which include Orlando, Phoenix, and Tampa. XNA additionally received $500K in funding to create a SFO route.
  • Expansion and growth: Separate from the flights, XNA has taken steps to making your experience even more fly with a new vendor, Einsteins Bagels, and a $30m+ expansion.

Checkout the full article HERE.

posts.title: New Year, New Budget For Some NWA Cities
posts.content:
The New Year is starting off on a high note for Northwest Arkansas cities as they enter with larger budgets for the 2023 year and beyond. Fayetteville and Springdale are among the cities that are expecting to have more funds for various projects and programs.

  • Focus on logistics: Fayetteville has a budget of $500M for the new fiscal year, which is an increase of $30M from the previous year, and plans to allocate additional funds for transportation and housing.
  • Safety first: Springdale, on the other hand, has a budget of $135M and is planning to put some of the funds towards improving infrastructure and public safety. Overall, it seems like the Ozarks area cities are in a strong financial position heading into the new year, with larger budgets that will enable them to undertake projects that will benefit the community.

Listen to the full report by KUAF HERE.

posts.title: Rogers Approves A Second Entertainment District At Promenade
posts.content:
On Tuesday night, the Rogers City Council approved its second entertainment district - the Bellview Entertainment District at the Promenade.

  • Cheers: Going into effect immediately, local businesses and vocal restaurants restaurants encouraged the adoption of the new district as a way to build community with beer.
  • The boundaries: The area includes the Promenade outdoor shopping area and the businesses across Bellview Road including Rendezvous Junction Brewing Company and Fox Trail Distillery.

Learn more about the new district, its boundaries, and more HERE.

posts.title: January Art on the Bricks in Downtown Rogers Tonight
posts.content:
Roger's January Art on the Bricks is here to warm your soul and brighten your day with its Finding Light in the Dark of Winter art walk.

  • On display: Tonight from 4:30-7:30p join the community of downtown Rogers for an evening of the arts with exhibits, music, and local food vendors. Featuring local artists and their creations, the art walk is sure to inspire and delight.
  • Shoutout: This month's highlight is with the Arkansas Arts Academy students art work and curriculum. Stroll through the downtown and explore the galleries and businesses that showcase the art.

Don't let the winter blues get you down, find some light in the dark of winter HERE.
